body_html:
@damienmg I understand the concern around the cost of clean --expunge.
however, in #10307 we are trying to use the existing environment variables to invalidate the cuda repo and get it to be rebuilt, with no results.
We tried to edit configure script to Provide defaults for TF_CUDNN_VERSION, where it was "" before, now we provided "6", but local_config_cuda still did not get rebuilt.

Could you chime in on that other pull request to direct us towards a working solution?
body_text:

however, in #10307 we are trying to use the existing environment variables to invalidate the cuda repo and get it to be rebuilt, with no results.
We tried to edit configure script to Provide defaults for TF_CUDNN_VERSION, where it was "" before, now we provided "6", but local_config_cuda still did not get rebuilt.
Could you chime in on that other pull request to direct us towards a working solution?
body:
@damienmg I understand the concern around the cost of clean --expunge.
however, in #10307 we are trying to use the existing environment variables to invalidate the cuda repo and get it to be rebuilt, with no results.
We tried to edit configure script to Provide defaults for `TF_CUDNN_VERSION`, where it was "" before, now we provided "6", but local_config_cuda still did not get rebuilt.

Could you chime in on that other pull request to direct us towards a working solution?
